intro: Gynocephalum, commonly known as the false gourd or yellow woodbine, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants are characterized by their compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers that often appear in umbels. They typically grow as annual or biennial herbs, often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. The fruits are dry, indehiscent legumes that contain a single seed.
